gozintograph.body: Generate a random gozintograph with an individually configurable difficulty and solve it under guidance with matrices or edge-multiplication!

success.title: Congratulations!
success.body: Do you want to solve another graph or want to check the Result again?

description.body: Generate a Gozintograph und calculate the secondary needs vector with matrices or edge value multiplication!
Build all paths and multiplicate according to the primary needs vector. Fill in the results into the secondary needs vector.
Calculate the direct needs matrix with matrix-multiplication or the inverse matrix.

Fill the direct-needs-matrix with the edge values of the graph. The matrix is read from left to top: [Row] * B0 are needed to produce [Column] 1 A0. Then fill in the unit matrix and subtract the direct needs matrix from it. The result needs to be filled in the last matrix.
Invert the resulting matrix of the previous step. Use your calculator to solve it, or click to fill it up.
Multiplicate the inverted matrix with the primary needs vector and fill in the results into the secondary needs vector. In order to do that, multiplicate each row with the primary needs vector.
Form the direct-need-matrix with the help of the graph. The matrix is read from top to left: [Column] * B0 are need for [Row] 1 A0. Form the unit matrix in the second matrix.

Form the matrices D^1 ... D^n with matrix multiplication, whereby n is the amount of the longest directed path in the gozintograph. Subsequently add the matrices with the unit matrix to produce the aggregate needs matrix.
